poem:
### Witness

In frames painted with shadows,
Leni's lens chisels history's cruelest script.
Flickers of deceit dance,
Where truth crouches silent, unseen.
Eyes wide, she claims innocence,
but the reel tells
of horrors etched in celluloid—
silver screens taint her gaze,
a witness blurred under klieg lights' glare.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Film suggests Nazis’ lead propagandist had role in 1939 massacre A new documentary on the Nazis’ favourite film-maker and lead propagandist Leni Riefenstahl suggests she was a direct witness to murderous crimes of the Third Reich she later claimed to have known nothing about, and may even have contributed to one herself. The film Riefenstahl, which premieres at the Venice film festival at the end of August, also claims that the propagandist admired the party". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
